items.What we like: Building blocks to make it easy to create collaborative applications e.g. multiplayer documents. APIs convert JS objects, lists and maps into CRDTs with managed sync of changes, conflicts, and offline support. Handles persistence of documents. REST API or SDKs for React, Zustand, Redux, Node.
items.What we dislike: JS-only. 128KiB payload size limit - you need to handle splitting data structures.

items.What is it?: CLI for querying files with SQL.
items.What we like: Allows querying different file types with SQL e.g. CSV, JSON, Parquet, Excel, Apache/Nginx logs. Uses SQLite under the hood. Supports multiple files as “table”, and joins between them. Query nested objects.
items.What we dislike: Piping files doesn’t work on Windows. Doesn’t support paths through nested arrays. Binaries only for x86_64.

items.What is it?: Store SSH keys in secure enclave.
items.What we like: SSH keys securely stored in Apple’s secure enclave. Works with git, SSH connections, etc. Authenticated via macOS, which allows you to use Touch ID and Apple Watch. Native management GUI. Open source.
items.What we dislike: Keys can’t be exported, which is by design and you should really have different keys per machine anyway.
